title: 10(4) (amended by section 9(c) of the Act of 2022) of the Assisted DecisionMaking (Capacity) Act 2015 (No. 64 of 2015), hereby make the following
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Assisted Decision-Making
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Assisted Decision-Making 

(Capacity) Act 2015 (Section 10(4)) Regulations 2023.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited assisted decision-making (capacity) act 2015 (section 10(4)) regulation 2023

title: 10(4) (amended by section 9(c) of the Act of 2022) of the Assisted DecisionMaking (Capacity) Act 2015 (No. 64 of 2015), hereby make the following
heading: In these Regulations –
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations – 

“Act of 2015” means the Legal Services Regulation Act 2015 (No. 65 of 
2015); 

“agreement” means a decision-making assistance agreement; 

“immediate family member” means – 

(a) 

a spouse, civil partner, or cohabitant, 

(b) 

a child, son-in-law or daughter-in-law, 

(c) 

(d) 

(e) 

(f) 

a parent, step-parent, mother-in-law or father-in-law, 

a brother, sister, step-brother, step-sister, brother-in-law or 
sister-in-law, 

a grandparent or grandchild, 

an aunt or uncle, or 

(g) 

a nephew or niece; 

“Principal Act” means the Assisted Decision-Making (Capacity) Act 2015 (No. 
64 of 2015).
text_norm: 2 regulation - act 2015 mean legal service regulation act 2015 (no 65 2015) agreement mean decision-making assistance agreement immediate family member mean - (a) spouse civil partner cohabitant (b) child son-in-law daughter-in-law (c) (d) (e) (f) parent step-parent mother-in-law father-in-law brother sister step-brother step-sister brother-in-law sister-in-law grandparent grandchild aunt uncle (g) nephew niece principal act mean assisted decision-making (capacity) act 2015 (no 64 2015)

title: 10(4) (amended by section 9(c) of the Act of 2022) of the Assisted DecisionMaking (Capacity) Act 2015 (No. 64 of 2015), hereby make the following
heading: 3. An agreement and any variation thereof shall –
text_raw:
3. An agreement and any variation thereof shall – 

(a) 

(b) 

be in accordance with the specifications made by the Director 
under section 10(4A) of the Principal Act, 

subject to Regulation 12, specify those personal welfare or 
property and affairs decisions, or both, to which the agreement 
relates, and 

(c) 

take effect from the date of its execution. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 2nd May, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [205] 3

title: 10(4) (amended by section 9(c) of the Act of 2022) of the Assisted DecisionMaking (Capacity) Act 2015 (No. 64 of 2015), hereby make the following
heading: 4. An agreement shall be executed as follows:
text_raw:
4. An agreement shall be executed as follows: 

(a) 

by the signature of the agreement by – 

(i) 

the appointer or a person on his or her behalf in 
accordance with Regulation 5, and 

(ii) 

the decision-making assistant; 

(b) by 

the attestation of 

in accordance with 
the signatures 
Regulation 6 and in the form specified by the Director under 
section 10(4A) of the Principal Act.
text_norm: 4 agreement shall executed follows (a) signature agreement - (i) appointer person behalf accordance regulation 5 (ii) decision-making assistant (b) attestation accordance signature regulation 6 form specified director section 10(4a) principal act

title: 10(4) (amended by section 9(c) of the Act of 2022) of the Assisted DecisionMaking (Capacity) Act 2015 (No. 64 of 2015), hereby make the following
heading: 5. An agreement may be signed on behalf of the appointer by a person
text_raw:
5. An agreement may be signed on behalf of the appointer by a person 
who has attained the age of 18 years and who is not a witness referred to in 
Regulation 6 if – 

(a) 

the appointer is unable to sign the agreement, 

the appointer is present and directs that the agreement be signed on his 

(b) 
or her behalf by the person, and 

(c) 

the signature of that person is attested in accordance with Regulation 6.
text_norm: 5 agreement may signed behalf appointer person attained age 18 year witness referred regulation 6 - (a) appointer unable sign agreement appointer present directs agreement signed (b) behalf person (c) signature person attested accordance regulation 6

title: 10(4) (amended by section 9(c) of the Act of 2022) of the Assisted DecisionMaking (Capacity) Act 2015 (No. 64 of 2015), hereby make the following
heading: 6. (1) The appointer, or the person signing on his or her behalf in
text_raw:
6. (1) The appointer, or the person signing on his or her behalf in 
accordance with Regulation 5, and the decision-making assistant shall sign the 
agreement in the presence of each other and in the presence of a witness to 
whom Regulation 7 refers and who – 

(a) 

(b) 

has attained the age of 18 years, 

is not an immediate family member of the appointer or of the 
decision-making assistant, and 

(c) 

is not an employee or agent of the decision-making assistant. 

(2) A witness referred to in paragraph (1) shall attest the signature of the 
appointer, or the person signing on his or her behalf in accordance with 
Regulation 5, and the signature of the decision-making assistant, by applying 
his or her own signature to the agreement.
text_norm: 6 (1) appointer person signing behalf accordance regulation 5 decision-making assistant shall sign agreement presence presence witness regulation 7 refers - (a) (b) attained age 18 year immediate family member appointer decision-making assistant (c) employee agent decision-making assistant (2) witness referred paragraph (1) shall attest signature appointer person signing behalf accordance regulation 5 signature decision-making assistant applying signature agreement

title: 10(4) (amended by section 9(c) of the Act of 2022) of the Assisted DecisionMaking (Capacity) Act 2015 (No. 64 of 2015), hereby make the following
heading: 7. A person may act as a witness under Regulation 6 if he or she is –
text_raw:
7. A person may act as a witness under Regulation 6 if he or she is – 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

a commissioner for oaths, 

a healthcare professional specified in Regulation 3 of the 
Assisted Decision-Making (Capacity) Act 2015 (Prescribed 
Classes of Healthcare Professionals) Regulations 2023, 

a member of any rank of the Garda Síochána appointed under 
Part 2 of the Garda Síochána Act 2005 (No. 20 of 2005) or 
under an enactment repealed by that Act, other than a member 
of the civilian staff of the Garda Síochána, 

(d) 

a member of 
denomination, 

the clergy or minister of any religious 

 
 
 
 
 4 [205] 

(e) 

a person who – 

(i) 

(ii) 

(iii) 

has been admitted as, and is, a member of a prescribed 
accountancy body within the meaning of section 900(1) of 
the Companies Act 2014 (No. 38 of 2014), 

is currently practising in the profession of accountancy, 
and 

is maintaining such minimum level of professional 
indemnity insurance as is required by the prescribed 
accountancy body concerned, 

a practising barrister within the meaning of section 2(1) of the 
Act of 2015, 

a practising solicitor within the meaning of section 2(1) of the 
Act of 2015, 

a registered dentist within the meaning of section 2 of the 
Dentists Act 1985 (No. 9 of 1985), 

a registered medical practitioner within the meaning of section 2 
of the Medical Practitioners Act 2007 (No. 25 of 2007), 

a registered pharmacist, being a person whose name for the time 
being is entered in the register of pharmacists, established and 
maintained under section 13 of the Pharmacy Act 2007 (No. 20 
of 2007), or 

(f) 

(g) 

(h) 

(i) 

(j) 

(k) 

an elected representative within the meaning of section 40 of the 
Data Protection Act 2018 (No. 7 of 2018).

title: 10(4) (amended by section 9(c) of the Act of 2022) of the Assisted DecisionMaking (Capacity) Act 2015 (No. 64 of 2015), hereby make the following
heading: 8. Regulations 4 to 7 shall apply to the variation of an agreement as
text_raw:
8. Regulations 4 to 7 shall apply to the variation of an agreement as 
agreed between the appointer and the decision-making assistant under section 
10(3) of the Principal Act, as they apply to the execution of an agreement, with 
any necessary modifications.
text_norm: 8 regulation 4 7 shall apply variation agreement agreed appointer decision-making assistant section 10(3) principal act apply execution agreement necessary modification

title: 10(4) (amended by section 9(c) of the Act of 2022) of the Assisted DecisionMaking (Capacity) Act 2015 (No. 64 of 2015), hereby make the following
heading: 9. The revocation of an agreement by an appointer or a decision-making
text_raw:
9. The revocation of an agreement by an appointer or a decision-making 

assistant under section 10(3) of the Principal Act shall – 

(a) 

be in accordance with the specifications made by the Director 
under section 10(4A) of the Principal Act, and 

(b) 

take effect from the date of its execution.
text_norm: 9 revocation agreement appointer decision-making assistant section 10(3) principal act shall - (a) accordance specification made director section 10(4a) principal act (b) take effect date execution

title: 10(4) (amended by section 9(c) of the Act of 2022) of the Assisted DecisionMaking (Capacity) Act 2015 (No. 64 of 2015), hereby make the following
heading: 10. Regulations 4 to 7 shall apply to the revocation of an agreement as they
text_raw:
10. Regulations 4 to 7 shall apply to the revocation of an agreement as they 
apply to the execution of an agreement, with any necessary modifications, 
including the following: 

(a) where the agreement is revoked by the appointer – 

(i) Regulation 4(a)(ii) shall not apply, 

 
 
 
 
 [205] 5 

(ii) Regulation 6(1) shall be read as if the words “and the 
decision-making assistant” and “in the presence of each 
other and” were deleted, and 

(iii) Regulation 6(2) shall be read as if the words “and the 

signature of the decision-making assistant,” were deleted; 

(b) where the agreement is revoked by the decision-making 

assistant – 

(i) Regulations 4(a)(i) and 5 shall not apply, 

(ii) Regulation 6(1) shall be read as if the words “The 
appointer, or the person signing on his or her behalf in 
accordance with Regulation 5, and” and “in the presence 
of each other and” were deleted, and 

(iii) Regulation 6(2) shall be read as if the words “the signature 
of the appointer, or the person signing on his or her behalf 
in accordance with Regulation 5, and” were deleted.

title: 10(4) (amended by section 9(c) of the Act of 2022) of the Assisted DecisionMaking (Capacity) Act 2015 (No. 64 of 2015), hereby make the following
heading: 11. Notwithstanding Regulations 9 and 10, where a decision-making
text_raw:
11. Notwithstanding Regulations 9 and 10, where a decision-making 
assistant becomes disqualified from being a decision-making assistant for the 
appointer under section 13 of the Principal Act – 

(a) 

(b) 

the agreement concerned shall be deemed to be revoked from 
the date of disqualification, or 

if there is more than one decision-making assistant appointed in 
the agreement concerned, that agreement shall be deemed to be 
revoked, insofar as it relates to the decision-making assistant 
who has become disqualified, from the date of disqualification.
text_norm: 11 notwithstanding regulation 9 10 decision-making assistant becomes disqualified decision-making assistant appointer section 13 principal act - (a) (b) agreement concerned shall deemed revoked date disqualification one decision-making assistant appointed agreement concerned agreement shall deemed revoked insofar relates decision-making assistant become disqualified date disqualification

title: 10(4) (amended by section 9(c) of the Act of 2022) of the Assisted DecisionMaking (Capacity) Act 2015 (No. 64 of 2015), hereby make the following
heading: 12. Any one or more of the following may be specified in an agreement:
text_raw:
12. Any one or more of the following may be specified in an agreement: 

(a) matters contained in paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d), (e), (ea) or (f) of 
the definition of “personal welfare” in section 2(1) of the 
Principal Act in relation to the appointer; 

(b) matters contained in paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d), (e), (f), (g), (h), 
(i), (j) or (k) of the definition of “property and affairs” in section 
2(1) of the Principal Act in relation to the appointer.
text_norm: 12 one following may specified agreement (a) matter contained paragraph (a) (b) (c) (d) (e) (ea) (f) definition personal welfare section 2(1) principal act relation appointer (b) matter contained paragraph (a) (b) (c) (d) (e) (f) (g) (h) (i) (j) (k) definition property affair section 2(1) principal act relation appointer

title: 10(4) (amended by section 9(c) of the Act of 2022) of the Assisted DecisionMaking (Capacity) Act 2015 (No. 64 of 2015), hereby make the following
heading: 13. (1) The appointer or decision-making assistant shall, not later than 5
text_raw:
13. (1) The appointer or decision-making assistant shall, not later than 5 
weeks after the execution of the agreement, and of any variation or revocation 
thereof, as the case may be, or such longer period as may be agreed in advance 
with the Director, give notice, in the form specified under section 10(4A) of the 
Principal Act, to the following persons of such execution: 

(a) 

the Director; 

(b) 

the spouse or civil partner (if any) of the appointer; 

(c) 

the cohabitant (if any) of the appointer; 

 
 
 
 
 6 [205] 

(d) 

(e) 

(f) 

(g) 

(h) 

(i) 

any children of the appointer who have attained the age of 18 
years; 

any co-decision-maker for the appointer; 

any decision-making representative for the appointer; 

any attorney for the appointer; 

any designated healthcare representative for the appointer; 

any other decision-making assistant for the appointer. 

(2) The notice referred to in paragraph (1) shall be accompanied by – 

(a) 

(b) 

a copy of the executed agreement, or the variation or revocation 
thereof, as the case may be, and 

any additional documents or matters specified by the Director 
under the Principal Act. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

26 April, 2023. 

RODERIC O'GORMAN, 

Minister for Children, Equality, Disability, Integration and 
Youth.
